data.q: Which function from the os module returns the current working directory?
data.e: os.getcwd() returns the current working directory as a string.

data.q: Which function from the os module changes the current working directory?
data.e: os.chdir(path) changes the current working directory to the specified path.

data.q: Which attribute of the sys module gives the list of command-line arguments?
data.e: sys.argv is a list containing the command-line arguments passed to the script.

data.q: Which function from the os module is used to remove a file?
Which function from the os module removes an empty directory?
Which sys function terminates the program?
data.e: sys.exit() raises SystemExit and terminates the program.

data.q: Which attribute of sys gives the version of Python being used?
data.e: sys.version returns a string containing the Python version.

data.q: Which function from the os module lists files and directories in a given path?
data.e: os.listdir(path) returns a list of entries in the given directory.

data.q: Which sys attribute gives the platform identifier?
data.e: sys.platform returns a string identifying the operating system platform.

data.q: Which os function is used to create a new directory?
data.e: os.mkdir(path) creates a new directory at the specified path.
